analysis.Summary: Vue single-file component that renders either an HTML audio player when a media URL is already provided, or an Upload input to let the user supply an embed URL/file. When a new URL is selected, it emits events to update the parent block and v-model binding.
analysis.Purpose: Acts as a media (audio/video) block in a page or post constructor. Allows users to view existing media content or upload/embed new media into a content block.

Components.name: Video.vue
Components.role: This component itself – handles display of existing media or an upload field and emits changes.

Components.name: Upload
Components.role: Reusable file/embed input component that produces a URL or embed code and emits a file-change event.

Functions.name: onComponentSave
Functions.purpose: Called when the Upload component reports a new URL; updates local state and emits 'input' and 'updateBlock' events upstream.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The new media URL or embed code provided by the Upload component.

Functions.name: updateBlock
Functions.purpose: Intended to locate and replace an updated block inside a post object, though not currently invoked in this file.

parameters.name: updatedBlock
parameters.description: Block to find and replace in the parent post content array.

analysis.Usage: Imported into a constructor or editor view via `import Video from 'modules/constructor/components/elements/Video.vue'`. Registered as a block component; parent passes in `prop` (block data) and listens to `input` and `updateBlock` events to synchronize state.
Notes: Despite the name 'Video', the template uses an <audio> tag; video support may need extension or rename for clarity.
The updateBlock() helper references `post.value` which is not defined in this scope – likely vestigial or intended for future use.
No <style> section is present; styling relies entirely on utility CSS classes.
The `Emit('updateBlock')` call includes two arguments (props.prop, payload) – parent components must handle this signature.
